alert.note: Alert for Salt Lake (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 6:48AM MDT until April 13 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity for the following rivers in Utah... Emigration Creek Near Salt Lake City affecting Salt Lake County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...After cresting overnight, Emigration Creek has fallen below flood stage, but impacts will continue through the morning. * WHERE...Emigration Creek Near Salt Lake City. * WHEN...Until early this afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - After peaking near 140 cfs overnight, the creek has dropped to 102 cfs, below action stage. - Forecast...The river will continue to fall over the next couple of days, dropped to near 55 cfs by Saturday afternoon. Rises are possible again early next week. - Flood flow is 126.0 cfs. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 125.0 cfs on 05/20/2011. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1200 PM MDT.
